message.content: {"id": "5340", "title": "Bug 5340: Cancelling add exception breakpoint has no effect", "description": "", "OB": "When attempting to cancel the process of adding an exception breakpoint, the progress dialog closes immediately. Eventually, the exception list comes up despite the cancellation request. This behavior is incorrect.", "EB": "The progress dialog should remain open if the operation is cancelled, and the exception list should not be displayed. Additionally, when calling ProgressMonitorDialog.run, the parameter for 'cancellable' should be set to false to disable the cancel button.", "SR": "Modify the implementation of adding an exception breakpoint so that it correctly handles the cancellation request. Update the ProgressMonitorDialog.run method to pass false for the 'cancellable' parameter to disable the cancel button."}

origin.input_prompt:
Your role is a senior software engineer, you are very good at analyzing and writing bug reports.
It is possible that the bug report may lack sufficient details in the OB, EB, and SR sections.  In such cases, your task is to infer the appropriate details based on the context and supplement the bug report to ensure it contains clear and complete OB/EB/SR statements.  Also, improve the wording of these statements for clarity where possible.
To facilitate this process, please provide your responses in JSON format as follows:
{"id": "", "title": "", "description": "", "OB": "", "EB": "", "SR": ""}
origin.input_content:
<BUG REPORT>

', 'EB': 'The progress dialog closes immediately4) Eventually the exception list comes up, it ignored the cancelation request.It should either honour the cancellation request or diable the cancel button(when calling ProgressMonitorDialog.run pass false for the canceleableparameter).
